quote.title: Grace Hopper
quote.text: It's easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.

quote.title: James Gleick
quote.text: When information is cheap, attention becomes expensive.
quote.source: The Information: A History, a Theory, a Flood

quote.title: Fred Brooks
quote.text: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.

quote.title: Steve Jobs
quote.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.

quote.title: Jeff Atwood
quote.text: Your app is a collection of tiny details. Getting the details right is the difference between something that delights, and something customers tolerate.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: You cannot understand good design if you do not understand people.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is innovative - The possibilities for innovation are not, by any means, exhausted. Technological development is always offering new opportunities for innovative design. But innovative design always develops in tandem with innovative technology, and can never be an end in itself.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Makes a product useful - A product is bought to be used. It has to satisfy certain criteria, not only functional, but also psychological and aesthetic. Good design emphasizes the usefulness of a product whilst disregarding anything that could possibly detract from it.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is aesthetic - The aesthetic quality of a product is integral to its usefulness because products are used every day and have an effect on people and their well-being. Only well-executed objects can be beautiful.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Makes a product understandable - It clarifies the product’s structure. Better still, it can make the product clearly express its function by making use of the user's intuition. At best, it is self-explanatory.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is unobtrusive - Products fulfilling a purpose are like tools. They are neither decorative objects nor works of art. Their design should therefore be both neutral and restrained, to leave room for the user's self-expression.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is honest - It does not make a product more innovative, powerful or valuable than it really is. It does not attempt to manipulate the consumer with promises that cannot be kept.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is long-lasting - It avoids being fashionable and therefore never appears antiquated. Unlike fashionable design, it lasts many years – even in today's throwaway society.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is thorough down to the last detail - Nothing must be arbitrary or left to chance. Care and accuracy in the design process show respect towards the consumer.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is environmentally friendly - Design makes an important contribution to the preservation of the environment. It conserves resources and minimizes physical and visual pollution throughout the lifecycle of the product.

quote.title: Dieter Rams
quote.text: Good design: Is as little design as possible - Less, but better – because it concentrates on the essential aspects, and the products are not burdened with non-essentials. Back to purity, back to simplicity.

quote.title: Joshua Kaufman
quote.text: Modals are often copouts for poor design. Modals are often used when the UI doesn’t accommodate the desired content. That’s when it can be better designed.

quote.title: Jeffrey Zeldman
quote.text: Design that does not serve people does not serve business.

quote.title: Albert Einstein
quote.text: If I had an hour to solve a problem I’d spend 55 minutes thinking about the problem and 5 minutes thinking about solutions.

quote.title: Yogi Berra
quote.text: You can observe a lot. Just by watching
Pride comes from the desire to create something great. Be prideful of your work.
Your job as a designer is to care. About every detail. You might not always win. But if you don't care who will?
You expect lag from a mouse, but if you touch something and it doesn't respond, you take it personally.

quote.title: Christian Heilmann
quote.text: Think of your product as an escalator: if your JavaScript does not execute, the website should still be usable as stairs.

quote.title: Luke Wroblewski
quote.text: Those who say "click" not "tap" quickly reveal their GUI roots.

quote.title: Jared Spool
quote.text: There are no shortcuts, Crappy user research produces crappy products. Plain and simple.

quote.title: Don Norman, circa 1990
quote.text: The real problem with the interface is that it is an interface. Interfaces get in the way. I don’t want to focus my energies on an interface. I want to focus on the job…I don’t want to think of myself as using a computer, I want to think of myself as doing my job.

quote.title: Will Sansbury
quote.text: You don't directly build a good product. You build a good team. Good products are a byproduct of good teams.

quote.title: Will Sansbury
quote.text: Our role is not to design everything ourselves but to equip the team to do good design.

quote.title: Michael Jordan
quote.text: I’ve missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.

quote.title: Nicolas Gallagher
quote.text: One way to reduce CSS frustrations, feature inadequacies, and maintenance problems seems to be to write/generate less CSS

quote.title: Albert Einstein
quote.text: If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough

quote.title: Janko Jovanovic
quote.text: It's easy to put rectangles on a page and call it a wireframe. But making it meaningful is a complex process that takes a lot more time.

quote.title: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote.text: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.

quote.title: Bruce Lee
quote.text: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.

quote.title: Elizabeth Buie
quote.text: If displaying feedback at the top of the page, make sure it doesn't move the main content down. Such movement messes up clicking.

quote.title: Gov.uk
quote.text: Remember we are designing information, not pushing pixels around a screen.

quote.title: Gov.uk
quote.text: Be consistent, not uniform.

quote.title: Cooper
quote.text: Creative minds in technology should focus on solving problems. Not just make interfaces.

quote.title: Cooper
quote.text: It’s time for us to move beyond screen-based thinking. Because when we think in screens, we design based upon a model that is inherently unnatural, inhumane, and has diminishing returns. It requires a great deal of talent, money and time to make these systems somewhat usable, and after all that effort, the software can sadly, only truly improve with a major overhaul.

quote.title: Harry Roberts
quote.text: There is no such thing as a semantic class, only sensible or insensible.

quote.title: Tim Berners-Lee
quote.text: Anyone who slaps a ‘this page is best viewed with Browser X’ label on a Web page appears to be yearning for the bad old days, before the Web, when you had very little chance of reading a document written on another computer, another word processor, or another network.

quote.title: Chris Heilmann
quote.text: If your website is 15MB it's not HTML5, it's stupid.

quote.title: Harry S. Truman
quote.text: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.

quote.title: Patrick Neeman
quote.text: One interaction designer for every four to eight developers seems to work best.

quote.title: Kris Gale
quote.text: Complexity cost is the debt you accrue by complicating features or technology in order to solve problems. An application that does twenty things is more difficult to refactor than an application that does one thing, so changes to its code will take longer. Sometimes complexity is a necessary cost, but only organizations that fully internalize the concept can hope to prevent runaway spending in this area.

quote.title: Kevin Powers
quote.text: One of Your Deliverables Should Be Education.

text.p: Ultimately, you remove the possibility of defeat by refusing to surrender.
Running out of money is not the end. Failure is when you lose the will to fight. Not a moment sooner. If you still believe in what you’re fighting for, press on.
This is more than a tactic. It is a game-altering move.

quote.title: Sun Tzu
quote.text: Do not worry about victory…remove the possibility of defeat.
quote.source: The Art of War, c. 554 BC - 496 BC

quote.title: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote.text: Noise is the supreme archenemy of all serious thinkers.
